projectPurpose: To provide a scalable and user-friendly source control system capable of handling extremely large repositories while offering an improved developer experience compared to existing tools, with compatibility for Git.
mainFeatures: Scalability for large repositories and monorepos
Git-compatible client for interacting with Git repositories
First-class support for working with stacks of commits
No staging area with interactive partial commits

alternatives.name: Apache Subversion (SVN)
mainFeatures: Support for directories as first-class objects

alternatives.name: Perforce Helix Core
mainFeatures: Designed for large scale and binary assets

marketPositioning: Sapling is positioned as a highly scalable and user-friendly source control system designed to address the challenges of managing extremely large repositories (monorepos) while improving the developer experience, particularly for workflows involving commit stacks and history manipulation. Unlike traditional centralized systems like SVN and Perforce (in its core mode), Sapling is distributed. While competing with Git and Mercurial in the distributed VCS space, Sapling differentiates itself by focusing on superior scalability for massive codebases and enhanced usability features, including first-class support for commit stacks and intuitive history management via the Smartlog. Its Git compatibility allows it to serve as an alternative client for existing Git users and facilitates adoption.
